project.teaser: The HUCAN project addresses legal and regulatory challenges of an ATM environment with higher levels of automation. Coherently with the SRIA, that advocates the need for new methodologies for validation and certification of advanced automation that ensure transparency, legal...
project.objective: The HUCAN project addresses legal and regulatory challenges of an ATM environment with higher levels of automation. Coherently with the SRIA, that advocates the need for new methodologies for validation and certification of advanced automation that ensure transparency, legal aspects, robustness and stability under all conditions and take full consideration for a future ATM environment built on multiple AI-algorithms system of systems with a human-centric approach, the HUCAN project proposes a novel approach for certification and approval of new ATM-related airborne and ground systems embedding higher levels of automation, including those based on AI and ML. The proposed approach is intended to support both the approval/certification and the design phases of such technologies, developing to this end two interconnected products: (1) a new holistic and unified certification method for highly automated systems, whose main target users are EASA, national aviation authorities, qualified entities, and ANSPs, and (2) a set of suitable design guidelines and associated toolkit for streamlining the development of automation and AI-powered technologies, targeted to manufacturers. For the design and development of such products the project will review the most prominent trends and challenges in automation and AI research and applications regarding ATM systems, also analysing possible approaches developed in other socio-technical and safety critical domains, and taking into account all possible impacts of higher levels of automation, including those on ATCOs licence and training. A parallel analysis of certification approaches, legal and regulatory features and critical issues of such technologies will be carried out. Case studies specifically focused on capacity on demand and dynamic airspace will feed and validate the theoretical research and the design of both the approval/certification approach and the guidelines for the design produced by the project.
project.title: Holistic Unified Certification Approach for Novel systems based on advanced automation
project.keywords: certification, automation, automated systems, ATM, artificial intelligence, legal, regulation, licence, training, machine learning

article.title: Certification approach for novel aerial traffic management systems based on advanced automation and AI

result.title: Guidelines Validation report
result.description: Results of the validation of the guidelines for advanced automation systems design and of the associated toolkit for application, as obtained from its application to the representative case studies described in D4.1.

result.title: Case studies introduction: level of automation analysis and certification issues
result.description: Description of the case studies addressed by the project, focussed in particular, on level of automation and operational impact of the ATM-related systems taken into account and on the associated certification issues.

result.title: Validation report
result.description: Results of the validation of the new method for approval and certification, as obtained from its application to the representative case studies described in D4.1.

result.title: Performance based requirements for advanced automation
result.description: Performance based requirements to be used in the new certification method to demonstrate safety of automation during normal, impaired operation and recovery phases of service provision.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Data management plan of the HUCAN project

result.title: Concept Outline
result.description: Outline of the concept developed by the project. The concept concerns the new holistic approach to certification of highly automated systems, that is entailed in the two products developed (i.e., the certification method and the guidelines for the developers) and the interconnected use of the two at systemic level.

result.title: Holistic approach to approval and certification of automated systems
result.description: New holistic approach to approval and certification of automated and AI-powered systems, further to its application to the selected use cases and the consequent consolidation based on the results of the validation activity.

result.title: Certification methods and automation: benefits, issues and challenges
result.description: State of the art on current certification methods and regulations of airborne systems, aerodromes and ATM systems and explore the suitability of current certification methods and approaches to advanced automation and AI-powered technologies

result.title: Intermediate CDE report and CDE plan update
result.description: Intermediate report on communication, dissemination, exploitation and stakeholders engagement activities carried out in the first half of the project and consistency with KPIs and associated success criteria listed in D6.1. It also includes an update f the CDE plan for the remaining part of the project, if needed.

result.title: CDE plan
result.description: Communication dissemination and exploitation plan of the HUCAN project providing CDE objectives and strategies and KPIs and associated success criteria

result.title: Exploratory research report
result.description: Final project report presenting an overview of all the activities carried out

result.title: Advanced automation in aviation
result.description: State of the art and lines of research and application of advanced automation and AI in transport, with a particular focus on aviation

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - HUCAN (Holistic Unified Certification Approach for Novel systems based on advanced automation)
result.teaser: In the forthcoming years, the role of highly automated and autonomous systems, including AI powered technologies, is going to increase at a fast pace in complex socio-technical systems. The ATM domain is not an exception. A recent study carried out upon request of the SESAR...

category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Preliminary guidelines for advanced automation systems design and toolkit for guidelines application
result.description: Preliminary guidelines for advanced automation systems design and of the associated toolkit for guidelines application, further to its application to the selected use cases and the consequent consolidation based on the results of the validation activity.

result.title: Intermediate Data Management Plan
result.description: Intermediate version of Data management plan of the HUCAN project

result.title: Innovative approaches to approval and certification
result.description: Most innovative approaches to approval and certification process of automated and AI-based technology and their analysis in order to show pros and cons of each of them, as well as suitability for the aviation domain

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
category.description: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
